intro: Hieracium ausugum, commonly known as the yellow hawkweed, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its bright yellow flowers and hairy stems, which help it retain moisture in dry environments. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a rough texture, while its root system is fibrous and shallow. Hieracium ausugum is known for its ability to spread rapidly through rhizomes, making it both a common weed and an indicator of soil conditions.
